node.title: String Functions in PHP
node.description: A string is a sequence of characters, like "Hello world!". For example, ‘P’ is a character and PHP is a string. In this article we will discuss about strings in details. Every thing inside quotes, single (‘ ‘) and double (” “) in PHP is treated as a string.

node.title: Declaring PHP Variables
node.description: In PHP, a variable starts with the $ sign, followed by the name of the variable PHP Variables A variable can have a short name (like x and y) or a more descriptive name (age, carname, total_volume).

node.title: Comments in PHP
node.description: A comment in PHP code is a line that is not executed as a part of the program. Its only purpose is to be read by someone who is looking at the code.

node.title: PHP Case Sensitivity
node.description: Php Case Sensitivity: In PHP, keywords (e.g. if, else, while, echo, etc.), classes, functions, and user-defined functions are not case-sensitive. However; all variable names are case-sensitive!

node.title: The PHP echo Statement
node.description: The PHP echo Statement: The echo statement can be used with or without parentheses: echo or echo().
